Ketone bodies are synthesized in liver in the fasting state, and the amount synthesized increases as fasting extends into starvation. Which one of the following statements about the fed and fasting metabolic states is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: In the fed state muscle can take up glucose for use as a metabolic fuel because glucose transport in muscle is stimulated in response to glucagon.

options.label: B
options.text: In the fed state there is decreased secretion of glucagon in response to increase glucose in the portal blood.

options.label: C
options.text: I the fed state, glucagon acts to increase the synthesis of glycogen from glucose.

options.label: D
options.text: Plasma glucose is maintained in starvation and prolonged fasting by gluconeogenesis from ketone bodies.

questions.correct_answer: B. In the fed state there is decreased secretion of glucagon in response to increase glucose in the portal blood.

questions.text: Match the following with shown images:

A 5-year-old boy is evaluated for recurrent infections and failure to thrive. He has been hospitalized for pneumococcal pneumonia twice and has had 4 episodes of otitis media. requiring placement of tympanostomy tubes. The patient also has a history of prolonged diarrhea caused by Cryptosporidium parvum. Physical examination shows large tonsils. palpable lymph nodes. and hepatosplenomegaly. Further evaluation pathogenesis shown in the image. Which of the following immunoglobulins likely has the highest serum concentration in this patient?

A 65-year-old man comes to the physician due to right-calf pain, redness and swelling He is diagnosed with cellulitis and is started on clindamycin A few days after starting treatment, he develops watery diarrhea and abdominal cramps. The patient is hospitalized, and complete blood count shows leukocytosis. The toxin most likely responsible for his current condition primarily damages which of the following components of intestinal mucosal cells?

An 8-year-old male is brought to the ER with a two day history of fever , abdominal pain and diarrhea Careful history taking reveals that the patient's pet puppy had diarrhea one week ago. Aside from the present episode, the patient has no significant past medical history, and all his vaccinations are up-to-date. His stool negative for ova and parasites. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's symptoms?

A 36-year-old immigrant from Peru presents to the clinic because of difficulty swallowing liquids. He says he also has difficulty belching. Physical examination is unremarkable Barium swallow shows a dilated oesophagus, and manometry confirms absent peristalsis in the smooth muscle portion of the oesophagus If this patient’s symptoms are caused by infection, which of the following organisms is the most likely cause?

A 34-year-old immigrant PLHIV complains of intermittent abdominal cramps. He has had multiple respiratory infections over the last 2 years as well as a persistent, chronic cough. Laboratory results are as follows: Complete blood count: Hemoglobin : 13.0 g/dL, Leukocytes : 6.800 cells/pL, Neutrophils 56%, Eosinophils 14%, Lymphocytes 26%, Monocytes 4%. questions.text: A 31-year-old man comes to the office due to oral lesions that cause occasional discomfort during eating, He also reports fatigue and unintentional weight loss. There are several enlarged cervical and axillary lymph nodes. Microscopy of the scrapping shown in the image. questions.text: Which of the following is false statement about Silk suture?

options.label: A
options.text: It loses its strength by 20% if made wet

options.label: D
options.text: It is preserved in ethylene glycol.

questions.correct_answer: D. It is preserved in ethylene glycol.

questions.text: A patient was found to have Ejection systolic murmur at left second intercostal space. What is the most likely cause of this murmur.
Identify the arrythmia in this ECG?

A 64-year-old Gentleman was admitted with cough and breathlessness. He had developed cough 2 days ago and has been having progressive worsening of breathlessness for 1 month. His saturation was 84% and was rushed to the ER. He is a diabetic, chronic smoker with history of COLD for 5 years on Bronchodilators. On examination, his pulse was 112/min regular with a BP of 100/74 mm of Hg and RR of 40/min. There was central cyanosis/ no clubbing/ edema feet is present. Auscultation revealed bilateral inspiratory wheeze. ECG revealed sinus tachycardia. Which test would be most helpful in emergency diagnosis of this case?

A 76 year –old lady presented to the ER with sudden onset palpitations. She has no other symptoms, or family history of similar disease. She is a known case of hypertension on Amlodipine and takes Atorvastatin for dyslipidaemia. On examination the pulse is 126 bpm, irregularly irregular in rhythm. BP is 124/80mm of Hg and the Spo2 is 98% on Room air. There are no eye signs, no murmurs. ECG was recorded and confirmed Atrial fibrillation with Fast ventricular rate. What is the CHA2DS2Vasc score in this patient?
Which of these findings are not seen in non-alcoholic fatty liver disease

A 26-year-old woman with prior history of IV drug abuse resulting in hepatitis C coinfection is seen in a prenatal clinic for routine care. She is in the third trimester of pregnancy with her first child. Which of the following statements regarding transmission of hepatitis C virus (HCV) to neonate is true?

options.label: A
options.text: Caesarean section reduces the risk of transmission to a greater degree than vaginal delivery.

options.label: B
options.text: Risk of transmission is 5% to neonate.

options.label: C
options.text: Breastfeeding is associated with very high risk of transmission.

options.label: D
options.text: Patients with HCV genotype 1 have a greater risk of transmission than other genotypes.

questions.correct_answer: B. Risk of transmission is 5% to neonate.

questions.text: A 32-year-old female non-smoker presented with sudden onset of cough followed by breathlessness. CXR revealed pneumothorax. She also gives history of similar episodes in the past. The most probable diagnosis is:
Following statements about Kartegener’s syndrome are true EXCEPT

A 75-year-old male presents with an acute stroke. On examination he has mild right arm and face weakness. He has spontaneous speech with occasional paraphasic errors. He can understand and follow commands. Repetition is severely impaired. Which of the following best explains his speech pattern?
Selective proteinuria in a Young boy with quantity more than 2g/day without Hematuria is most probably due to:

A 25 year old man with a 6-year history of HIV-AIDS complicated recently by PCP was treated with high dose Co-Trimoxazole. On day 4 of treatment, the following laboratory data was obtained as follows : Na+ -135, K+-6.5, Cl-110, HCO3-15, pH-7.30, BUN-14, Creatinine-0.9, Osmolarity -268. What is the diagnosis ?
questions.correct_answer: A. Non Anion gap metabolic acidosis

questions.text: In Glomerulonephritis, the poor prognostic factors include/s

A 25-year-old male cigarette smoker has a history of respiratory infections and has also been found to have hematuria. A high value for diffusing capacity is noted during pulmonary function testing. This finding is consistent with which of the following disorders?

A 78-year-old gentleman presented with sudden onset confusion and imbalance with walking. He had a similar episode 3 days ago which was treated as vertigo with temporary relief of symptoms. He is a known diabetic, hypertensive on regular medication. The relatives deny any history of fall/fever/ear discharge. CT Brain was performed. Following statements his diagnosis are true Except:

options.label: A
options.text: Maybe Spontaneous in Elderly and alcoholics

options.label: C
options.text: Source of bleeding is Bridging veins

options.label: D
options.text: Prognosis with early surgery is excellent.

questions.correct_answer: D. Prognosis with early surgery is excellent.

questions.text: A 66 year old lady was admitted to the neurology clinic with myoclonic jerks. She had developed aggressive and abnormal behaviour towards her spouse 4 months ago and was started on anti-psychotic medications. However, her behaviour did not improve and she developed difficulty in walking. MRI was performed. Most probable diagnosis is?
Which of the following is least consistent with Guillain-Barré syndrome?
questions.explanation:
References:

  • ↳ Sol:
  • ↳ • Guillain-Barré syndrome may occur after contracting an infectious disease, a collagen vascular disease exacerbation, or an exposure to toxins.
  • ↳ • In general, the lower extremities are involved first and are affected more severely than the upper extremities.
  • ↳ • The bulbar musculature may also be involved. Reflexes are affected early, and lack of deep tendon reflexes is a hallmark finding.
  • ↳ • Recovery may take months to years but is usually complete.

questions.text: In herpes simplex encephalitis:

options.label: D
options.text: Cold sores or genital herpes are usually present

questions.correct_answer: B. Temporal lobe involvement is common
questions.explanation:
References:

  • ↳ Sol:
  • ↳ • MRI brain normally shows changes in the temporal lobes.
  • ↳ • Presenting features include fever, headache, vomiting, reduced consciousness and seizures. There may be dysphasia, hallucinations and peculiar behaviour. There are usually no skin manifestations of herpes simplex infections.
  • ↳ • The virus is rarely isolated from CSF but may be detected by PMR.

questions.text: The most common causative organism for lobar pneumonia is
The most common histological type seen in bronchogenic carcinoma is :
Following clinical sign is unilateral in

options.label: B
options.text: A cervical myelopathy secondary to cervical spondylosis.

options.label: D
options.text: A right middle cerebral artery ischemic stroke.

questions.correct_answer: D. A right middle cerebral artery ischemic stroke.

questions.text: In anemic hypoxia PaO2 will be
Kussmaul's sign is seen in all except –
Prevalence of portal vein thrombosis in cirrhosis is:
The only organ involvement which is more common in CREST syndrome as compared to Diffuse Systemic Sclerosis is
Measurement of which urinary electrolyte is particularly useful in the diagnosis of a patient with metabolic alkalosis?

A 33 years old G2P1L1 with 14 weeks of gestation has carcinoma of cervix which is stage 1A1 with depth involvement of 1mm. She wants to continue pregnancy. Which of the following is optimal treatment?

options.label: C
options.text: Cannot continue pregnancy, MTP and simple hysterectomy

questions.text: A 26 years old Primigravida with 16 weeks of gestation came with quadruple marker test. Her HCG, UE3 and inhibin A reports were normal but AFP was raised 3 times MoM. What is the next best line of management?

A 43 years old P2L2 patient underwent PAP smear (liquid based). Her report came out as atypical glandular cells. Which of the following is needed for this patient? 1: Colposcopy 2: Endocervical curettage 3: HPV DNA test 4: Endometrial curettage
Which one of the following is not a correct match?

options.label: A
options.text: Schiller Duval bodies---- Endodermal sinus tumour

questions.correct_answer: C. Brenner tumour---- Call Exner bodies

questions.text: A 35 years old Primigravida with 8 weeks of gestation has vomiting since last 1 week, her pulse is feeble, 110/minute. Her BP is 100/70 mm Hg. She has signs of dehydration. Which of the following is not likely to be seen in the investigations?
questions.correct_answer: D. Raised K+ levels in serum

questions.text: A 28 years old Primigravida had a successful IVF pregnancy with USG suggestive of intra uterine gestation of 6 weeks with cardiac activity+. She had syncopal attack and came to emergency room. her pulse was feeble, 130/min and BP was 80/40 mm Hg. USG was showing significant free fluid in abdo-pelvis. Ascitic tapping revealed blood. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which one of the following is not the use of the following instrument?
A 35 years old nulliparous patient had FIGO type 2-5 fibroid with menorrhagia and infertility. Which of the following is best treatment for this case?

options.label: D
options.text: Tranexamic acid for menorrhagia with IUI

questions.text: Which one of the following is not increased in pregnancy?
questions.correct_answer: A. Colloidal oncotic pressure in blood

questions.text: Which one of the following is a marker of persistent GTD after molar evacuation?

options.label: A
options.text: HCG is present even after 4 months of S and E

options.label: D
options.text: Histopathology is suggestive of villous hyperplasia

questions.correct_answer: C. HCG is rising for 2 weeks

questions.text: An infertile patient underwent hysteroscopy which revealed the following picture. Which of the following is not correct in the treatment of this condition?

options.label: B
options.text: Pediatric Foley’s insertion along with oral estrogen

options.label: D
options.text: IVF and ET in secretory phase of this patient’s cycle

questions.correct_answer: D. IVF and ET in secretory phase of this patient’s cycle

questions.text: Which one of the following conditions is not associated with precocious puberty?
The most accurate method of assessing gestational age is CRL till how many weeks?
A 24 years old primigravida with 27 weeks of gestation has leaking PV. On examination it was found to be PPROM with cephalic presentation. What is the next line of management?

options.label: C
options.text: Antibiotics, steroids and wait till 34 weeks

options.label: D
options.text: Antibiotics, steroids, MgSO4 and induction of labor at 34 weeks.

questions.correct_answer: D. Antibiotics, steroids, MgSO4 and induction of labor at 34 weeks.

questions.text: Which of the following statements is incorrect regarding the given contraceptive?

options.label: C
options.text: It is freely available at govt. hospitals

questions.text: A 29 years old female was found to have uterine didelphys. Which one of the following is not likely in this case?
A 16 years old girl has not got her menses and secondary sexual characters are poor. Her Sr. FSH level is 0.01IU/L. Which of the following diagnosis suits the case?
A 23 years old nulliparous patient has had rubella vaccination. She wants to conceive now. She is advised to avoid conception for how many months?
As per ICMR and NIRRH regarding guidelines of COVID-19 in pregnancy, close contact with confirmed case is defined as all the following except?
Which one of the following is not correct regarding complete molar pregnancy?

options.label: A
options.text: Hypertension is more common than general pregnant population

options.label: B
options.text: Raised TSH is seen in most cases

options.label: C
options.text: Reduced hemoglobin is common due to hemorrhage

questions.correct_answer: B. Raised TSH is seen in most cases

questions.text: A 35 years old patient had cyclic hematuria at the time of her menses. Which of the following is the possible cause?
Which one of the following is not a cause of azoospermia?
Which one of the following is not an indication of IUI?
Which one of the following is not seen in MCDA twins?

A 38 years old patient is pregnant for 6th time. She had one full term normal delivery and there is male baby of 9 years old. Then she had two consecutive abortions of 9 weeks each. She had an ectopic pregnancy after that for which she underwent medical management at 6 weeks. After this, she had preterm twin delivery at 34 weeks, 3 years back and both the babies are fine. Right now, she is pregnant with 12 weeks (USG is suggestive of DCDA twins). What is her obstetric formula?

A 28-year-old is being transfused blood for first time, 10 minutes into transmission he complains of heaviness in tongue and has slurred speech, Examination shows Urticaria and BP is 80/60. Which of the following is immediate management in this patient?

A 38-year-old lady is doing work from home since the onset of pandemic, she works for 8-10 hrs a day and eats lots of junk food and does not eat fresh fruits and vegetables. Now she has easy fatigue. Peripheral blood smear as shown. methylmelanoic acid levels are normal and Urinary FIGLU is increased. Which of the following treatment should be started in her?

A patient presents with easy fatigue, Hb 8g/dL, MCH 22, MCV 70, Retic count 1.4%. Serum ferritin is 20µg/L, serum Iron is 22µg/dL. The patient is started on oral iron after four weeks her Hb is 7.6, Retic count is 1.4. which of the following is next line of management?

options.label: B
options.text: Bone marrow aspirate with Prussian blue stain

questions.text: Deficiency of ADMATS 13 leads to?
A patient with left ventricular ejection fraction of 35% was diagnosed of a cardiomyopathy, which of the following is true about this?
A renal biopsy from a patient shows changes as shown in the image. Which of the following is most likely cause for such a manifestation?
Hematological manifestation of systemic lupus erythematosus are which type of hypersensitivity?
Which of the following does not manifest with pancytopenia with hepatosplenomegaly?

A 5-year child is having recent onset hypertension, imaging shows a suprarenal mass. His father was diagnosed of medullary carcinoma of thyroid a many years back. You start suspecting a familial cancer in this child. Which of the following is most likely mutation?
Which of the following tumors occurs due to defect in DNA mismatch repair?
questions.correct_answer: A. Hereditary non polyposis colonic cancer

questions.text: A 56-year man presents with multiple patechiae for many months, now he is having breathlessness. Investigation shows a cardiomyopathy, peripheral blood examination shows Hb 10, TLC 10000, DLC N-55, L-25, Eo-12, Mono-8. Which of the following is likely to be seen in this patient?
A 65 year male presents with easy fatigue. Peripheral blood examination is as shown below. Which of the following investigation will help in diagnosis?
A Punjabi woman is suspected of thalassemia carrier and undergoes PBS & CBC. Which of the following is suggestive of thalassemia minor?

A 67-year-old man has recently developed interest in farming and gardening. For last two years he is actively involved. Now the patient is having breathlessness, chest imaging shows few fibrotic patches, a biopsy was done and is as shown in the image. What is the likely diagnosis?
Renal biopsy from a patient presenting with hematuria shows cresents. Immunofluroscence shows no deposits. Which can cause manifestation?
